Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: Sunbird121
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel in an odd manner during my research for my trip to Sydney. I was looking at the location of another hotel on Google Maps,and saw this one listed. After looking it up and inquiring,I decided to reserve it for my 6 night stay,March 6-11,2012. At $109/nt AUD,it was cheaper than most hotels for a private room with ensuite bathroom,and the location seemed to be ideal (short of having a harbour view,that is:) I found the hotel easily upon leaving the Town Hall station. It was located next to a HUGE supermarket,Woolworth's.Upon my arrival,the receptionist Jen greeted me warmly,and locked up my bags since it wasn't time to check in. She seemed genuinely apologetic that there wasn't a room available. She gave me a city map and directions to my first attraction. When I returned a few hours later, I encountered the beginning of a horrific experience with my bank declining my card. Long story short,the night receptionist,Natalia,did what she could to assist me.She helped me plug in my dying cell pone,gave me water, and sympathized. When it became apparent that I couldb't reach my bank or access any funds,she conferred with the manager and allowed me to check in for the night,with the understanding that it would be fixed the next day. She even gave me a free drink voucher for the Mezz Bar,citing that I needed it. She assisted me in carrying my bags up the claustrophobic elevator(very reminiscent of European elevators) while I took the stairs. Upon entering my room, I found it to be clean,small,but bigger than the last single room I had in Europe. There was a queen sized bed,desk,TV,mini-fridge,good sized closet and small bathroom with shower. I was a bit stumped by the two buttons on the toilet,but can assume the difference..... The window faced Park St,and I could see the large Galleries Victoria across the street,along with other stores littering the street,and McDonalds catticorner from the hotel. In the other direction you can see the QVB. Also,beside these two mega shopping complexes,the Pitt St Mall is about 3 minutes away. The next day,as I attempted to resolve my banking woes,the day receptionist Jen was still pleasant and helpful.She lend me a three pronged electric adaptor for my laptop,as well as a hairdryer.Whn I was in tears outside my room,two of the maids took the time to allow me to vent and chatted with me,making me feel better. Although my bank issue lasted throughout the day,I was able to withdraw enough cash to pay for my stay,and Jen was able to put a large amount of my cash in the safe. She was very thorough in securing it in an envelope,and reassured me of the security. During my stay,every receptionist greeted me whenever I entered and left,and always provided advice and tourism tips. I felt very secure as a single woman staying there,even without a receptionist there overnight.The manager stood outside the adjacent bar and watched the locked door of the hotel entrance. Not that it mattered,as the streets of Sydney seemed quite safe,even late at night. My checkout was smooth,and my cash was securely returned to me. The manager even stored my bags when I realized that I left an hour early,so that i could run out and fit in one last walk on the harbor. Overall,the room was clean,comfortable,and safe,which was the basic need I had in a hotel. Add to that,the location was superb,and with the Town Hall station a block away,Circular Quay was 10 minutes away. These two qualities would have been enough for me to give it a high mark,as I dont really notice fading carpets and the like. And I know a lot of people equate great hotels as those posh ones with exquisite views,fancy amenities and luxurious bath products. But to me,customer service is exactly what those at Hotel Coronation provided for me. In time of need,they went above and beyond to assist me and put me at ease.I can't say that the staff at say, a Hilton or Marriott would have done the same. To me,that is worth every dollar I spent and more. Would I stay at Hotel Coronation again or recommend to others? In a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in the heart of the city for those looking for a decent stay”
Reviews.Author: rajan_g4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. We asked for upper levels to avoid being disturbed by street noise as the hotel is on a busy street. The hotel itself is fairly old, 4 levels, narrow entrance, next to a pub. The lift is pretty old and will need some muscles to open and close the lift door. The rooms are small with small bathroom and toilet. I guess the location is the one which grabs all the points. Its well placed right in the heart of the city, 5 mins walk to Sydney Tower and to Darling Harbour. There's a supermarket within 1 min from the hotel which was of great help to us. Compared to the other hotels around, we thought this to be a great bargain ($109/night) for what we were after.

Reviews.Title: “could not fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: michelle w
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Coronation Hotel for 4 nights with my 7 year old daughter. After reading some of these reviews I must say I was a little edgey. My mind was soon put at rest . The room was spotless and the staff could not have been more helpful. Yes the lift was an experience however we found it easy to operate and my duaghter could hold the door open, so I'm sure older people could survive. Our room was quiet and cleaned every day. There was no smoke smell. The location was a wonderful base for us. I think the negative reviews should not discourage anyone from staying here . You will NOT get better value for money or more friendly staff . We certainly will return .

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Paddleboat4321
Reviews.Content: We loved the location and proximity to all sydney has to offer...the hotel was great and the staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “"Value for money"”
Reviews.Author: Sharon261615
Reviews.Content: I had read previous reviews and they were all correct, what a little gem!! Would definitely recommend, thanks Bec for a friendly/helpful welcome : )

Reviews.Title: “Noise, noise noise”
Reviews.Author: BL1947
Reviews.Content: Sydneyâ€™s Hotel Coronation has so much potential. Perfectly located in the heart of the city within minutes of Town Hall station, a monorail station, dozens of eateries of all types and right next door to a Woolworths supermarket (more on that later). Priced below $120 a night, the rooms are small, but comfy with a tiny, but serviceable bathroom. But nightmares start late at night. Woolworths has a procession of semi-trailers unloading until long after midnight. Slamming the empty produce racks onto the tailgate makes a huge noise, but there are dozens of these trolleys to be loaded over a period of 3 hours. By 1230, theyâ€™re normally finished. But it doesnâ€™t stop there. At 0515 clanging and thumping of beer kegs will break your dreams. A truck driver throws full, steel beer kegs onto the footpath, then slaps them on their side and down the cellar chute. There one of the hotel staff drags then across the concrete floor. The sound travels throughout the hotel. Trying to sleep above on the third floor it sounds like someone dragging concrete pot plants across the floor above. Next night? Same thing, with the hotel manager the culprit. Dragging the empty kegs at 0525 in preparation for the loading on the truck at 0623. Clanging kegs are thrown on back of the truck below the hotel windows. So if you enjoy your sleep, find another hotel. Did I mention the lift? It should be heritage listed. Donâ€™t bother to go to Luna Park â€“ get your thrills riding in the Coronation lift. The stupid thing is that all these problems can be easily fixed with double glazed windows, changing delivery times and a new, enlightened manager. Management seems focused on running a drinking establishment more than an accommodation hotel. Thankfully, the nice receptionist refunded the two extra nights and we moved out to a nice quiet hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location.”
Reviews.Author: TomQLD1960
Reviews.Content: Excellent value and location, plus we got an upgrade. Downsides- a little street noise and cigarette smoke. We stayed on level 2, so I'd recommend level 4, the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Cigarette smoke was a problem”
Reviews.Author: holidaycommentator
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great spot right near Town Hall and we were happy with both of our rooms in every aspect but one. We stayed here prior to taking a cruise departing from Sydney but we will not be able to stay again for our next cruise and have booked elsewhere at the Metro in Pitt Street. Its a shame because the location and price were both right. I dont really understand how it happens but on the two nights that we stayed in this hotel, somehow despite the hotel itself being a non smoking hotel with non smoking rooms I gather, we experienced constant cigarette smoke all night. It was somehow getting into the rooms. My guess, and its only a guess is that because the pub section does not allow smoking inside, people step just outside the pub to smoke. There was a light smoke smell during the day when we saw a few people outside the door smoking but not too bad. However, I think that as the night goes on and the pub underneath fills up, more and more people are standing outside perhaps 10 or so at a time all smoking. This smoke then wafts up the stairwell which is adjacent and leads to the hotel acoomodation or somehow travels throughout the entire building through ductwork or channels that we did not bother to investigate. We just knew that unfortunately we could not stay again in future. I found it difficult to breath. Its a shame as I dont really have anything against smoking as such its just that I get sinus trouble if I am exposed to smoke. Anyway, if you are a smoker or dont mind the smell of smoke then this is a good option for a hotel but if you have sinus trouble then only stay as a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location. good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: richiemccaw
Reviews.Content: I got the name of this hotel off an internet forum and decided to run along with it. The location was really fantastic. It was very easy to get there from the airport via the subway (remember to buy a MyMulti pass for your stay in Sydney). There is a Woolworths right next door with shopping malls, shopping streets, cinemas and many places to eat nearby. It did not really sink in until I went to stay in Bounce Hotel for the last two nights of my stay (wanted to check that place out). Admittedly the rooms are not of the best standards but for at the price point (AU$109/night) and the location, you really cant expect that much. The restroom/shower area was clean and adequate space-wise. The TV is small and slightly spoilt so unless you are planning to spend a lot of time in the room, that would not be much of an issue. Both of us slept very very well throughout the night even though the hotel was right smack in the city centre. The staff at the reception was excellent too. They were very helpful when we needed directions to places like Sydney Fish Market. I would definitely recommend this hotel to travellers who are on a budget and just require a place to have a good night's sleep. If you need to travel to other places, Town Hall station is just one stop away from Central station. All in all, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: Nms7
Reviews.Content: I learnt from the website that this hotel is located upstairs from a bar, I was prepared for the noise and rowdiness during my nights there. Little did I know that it's the quietest bar in town and my partner and I had good sleeps without any disturbance. We spent a good duration of time there. Drinks are very affordable and the bar staffs are friendly. Getting into the 'ancient' lift was an adventure each time but we took the stairs down which was more convenient. This hotel is central to Sydney CBD; we even walked to Oxford Street and the Sydney Opera House. The downside to our room was that the television was quite bad - the power switch was broken and the remote was out of battery. Otherwise, the bed was good and the toilets are clean. Although the rooms are small sized, it was satisfactory for us as we are out and about the whole day.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, cheap and central”
Reviews.Author: SharnaRJ
Reviews.Content: Hotel Coronation was a great place to stay if you want somewhere in the heart of the city and cheap. The staff were very friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “City to Surf - Great location”
Reviews.Author: YogiBearVisiting
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coronation the weekend of the City to Surf and we couldn't have asked for anything better. It was convenient in location. It was convenient with the shops it had surrounding it. And most importantly it was convenient on my purse. It was great to feel comfortable and at the same time be in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Was a great choice”
Reviews.Author: nannygoatjunction
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just the one night before boarding the cruise ship Queen Mary 2. We really only needed somewhere central and a room to stay in, nothing fancy. We certainly didn't get fancy however we were amazed at the value! A very old establishment with good attempts at some refurbishment. A clean, tidy room that did have a smoked odour despite being a non-smoking room. A very small balcony that was rather bohemian but appreciated. A tiny, but quaint office with efficient staff and security. As mentioned by other reviewers, the lift should indeed be heritage listed (or something) we barely squeezed in with our luggage and the clanging and banging and barely closing doors created an experience in itself but definitly servicable! The hotel is smack bang in the middle of everything, buses, trains, eating. Absolute bang for our buck in this instance.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend Hotel Coronation”
Reviews.Author: 1once
Reviews.Content: I just had my first trip to sydney with my best friend. We stayed at Hotel Coronation because of its good reviews and we were not disappointed. When we read it was in a great location, they were right. it was super close to everything!! There's a bus stop just around the corner and the train station just metres away. If you rather walk, it is just 15 minutes to Darling Harbour and 30 minutes to the Rocks and the Opera House. You can find places to eat everywhere and a macdonalds just across the street. It was also convenient that there was a woolworths next door to pick up any last mintue items (you can also have internet access there too). In addition, I found the service was pretty good. Friendly and polite staff. The room I had was very clean. I didnt think there was much noise at night. The down side was that there was no hairdyer, some channels on the TV didnt work and that the elevator can be annoying as it was diffcult to open and close. But overall, it was a great hotel and I would stay there agian and I recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Value”
Reviews.Author: Johnpnz7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. Super helpfull and obliging staff. 20 meters to the town hall station. Next door to super market where you can buy most things. Easy walk to all the major Sydney shops and malls.Great restaurant. A great place to stay and wont bust your budget. Room was great. With an interesting view of the street below.Noise was not an issue. A charming hotel. will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Island124
Reviews.Content: Travelling alone in Sydney for the first time in many years I was pleasantly surprised to find the welcoming service of the staff at The Coronation. Located in a safe, central location and close to shops I recommend this affordable accommodation to anyone. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Close to all transport”
Reviews.Author: weed1939
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight and what a pleasant surprise. Although only a small hotel in the heart of Sydney you couldn't ask for a better location. All forms of transport are easily accessible-such as mono-rail, buses, rail station plus shopping is close by. Just a few doors away is a supermarket, there are places to get early breakfast, and coffee shops within a few hundred metres. Only a short walk to the Tower. The rooms are very small but all conveniences are available. Tea/coffee making is provided, a small refrigerator is very handy. The bathroom was quite well appointed and large enough. Above all it was VERY Clean.The lift is very old and small , but quite quaint with the old side back grill as well as a sliding door. The restaurant is open most times, and although the bar is 24 hour we did not have any problem with hotel or street noise. Reception seems just like a cupboard in the wall, but the service was friendly and easy going. Anyone looking for a very reasonable priced hotel in the heart of the CBD - only $109 for the room per night. Would need to go a long way to find a better location for the price. Would willing stay there again, but not seek a balcony room which we had as it intrudes into the room space. With reverse cycle a/c what more can you ask for. Rooms are spotless and sheets are fresh and crisp. Loved our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: aaa1Perth
Reviews.Content: We were booked to stay here for 2 nights but ended up checking out of our room at midnight on the first night and finding somewhere else to stay. The bed in the room should have been thrown out years ago, as you felt every single spring in the matrass and needed a ladder to climb out of the hole you created. The air conditioner (split system unit) in the room was really noisey and impossible to sleep with it running and was no doubt in need of the filters being cleaned.....it didn't help that it's positioned right over your bed either. The remote for the TV didn't work, there was a bedside lamp missing and the walls are paper thin meaning you hear every person walking/talking in the hallway outside

Reviews.Title: “Good spot, good value, good service...and a good nights sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Adzaway
Reviews.Content: Although not feted as a King at his Coronation, I was more than happy with my 3 night mid-week stay at the Hotel. Experienced a bit of late evening noise (street deliveries, not from the bar), although not much past 11pm. Morning sounds around 7:30am...but hey, I had a window room and was staying in central Sydney. Location is excellent - take the train, hop on the monorail, or walk to Darling Harbour, Circular Quay, Hyde Park, etc. Reception staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and comfortable. The lift was "entertaining", a definite struggle with a bit of baggage. Cleaners do the rounds fairly early - around checkout time - so good luck if you want a sleep-in. The Coronation suited me.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Location”
Reviews.Author: pumwee1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for one night. The lobby was a surprise, it couldn't have been smaller. However the room was comfortable although small. The price is right and the location is great, walking distanced to the Opera House, etc. Good value for the money. The elevator us unique - haven't seen one of those in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Hotel Coronation”
Reviews.Author: timeoutdee
Reviews.Content: I booked hotel coronation very early on in the year but was dreading getting there after reading a couple of unsatisfactory reviews on this site before I headed off to Oz. I have to say that I found this hotel to be absolutely brilliant - great location, friendly staff, clean room which was serviced on a daily basis and with all the facilities in the room which we needed. The room we had was on the fourth floor (room 402 with a balcony - much recommended!) and although a little noisy, it was not as bad as I had imagined it would be with a 24 hour bar downstairs. If you are a very light sleeper, ear plugs would do the trick. Great budget hotel in a fantastic location opposite Town Hall station.

Reviews.Title: “great for the price”
Reviews.Author: 111Nsw
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic, walking distance to Darling Harbour, for the price the rooms are good with clean facilities. It's a great place to stay if you want to shop, with the Queen Victoria Building just down the road and you can drop your shopping off and go again. It's close the the movies and lots of restaurants. You can even stroll down to the harbour. As for the lift I use the stairs anyway as it is only a four storey hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ever Experience”
Reviews.Author: SongbirdMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I called the hotel reception on 12/Dec/06 and booked two rooms for five nights to work at a trade show in Sydney. We stayed here before, although not impressed by the hotel itself, it's location is great. But when we arrived, the staff told us we didn't book! I gave her the booking details, she said she didn't know and I can talk to the manager. The manager who also runs the bar next door, came over and said: as far as he is concerned, we could be just anyone from the street asking for accommodation. Not only that they don't honour our bookings, he also shouted and humiliated us! He is by far the worst person I've ever come across. I've travelled to many parts of the world, this is the worst experience ever.

Reviews.Title: “greta location”
Reviews.Author: foggy58
Reviews.Content: Just back from 5 days in Sydney staying in Hotel Cornation. Our room was comfortable,clean, & we didnt have any of the problems that the other reviews have mentioned. But we did have a problem on our first night with council workers who decided to start with a jack hammer at 9.00 at night,by 10.00 it was still going on, i tried to contact manager on the number given in hotel information no luck so i phoned down to the bar & spoke with staff on duty who very pleasant , helpful & who said they would try to find out what was happening. Anyway to cut a long story short they managed to get it stopped at 12.00. Next morning we asked to see the manager. He was friendly, helpful. While we there he phoned the local council to find out what was happening, he said the hotel had never been told of the work which was being done outside but he would try & find out & ask for work not to be done at unsociable hours. We asked to be moved into another room just incase the work was to continue.So we packed up our case & they moved us into a room at the back of the hotel for the rest of our stay. For a budget hotel in such a central location we thought it was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “My worst travel experience”
Reviews.Author: SAusN
Reviews.Content: Do not stay in this hotel. I stayed here in November, and had a truly appalling experience. The bed I was in was full of insects, which resulted in me obtaining about a hundred red and swollen bites all over my body, including my face. This was extremely distressing for me, as I was in Sydney to greet international visitors. If this was not bad enough, the standard of the room was terrible â€“ accommodation at youth hostels is far better. The furniture in my room was patched up with tape. The lighting in the bathroom was so dim I had to leave the door open to be able to see anything. The television only showed one channel, and had no remote control. In addition to this, â€˜receptionâ€™ (a tiny hole in the wall) is only open from 8am to 8pm, which for me made complaining about any of these problems impossible. I have never in my life seen a hotel that touts itself at this star rating put a sign up for patrons to drop off their room keys at the bar next door. In short, this was the worst travel experience I have ever had. I would give it zero stars if I could.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing & Management extremely unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: InQueensland
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews from this site & being on a budget, we contacted the hotel to book a weeks stay towards the end of April 2007. We were very happy with the lady who took the booking & we opted for a slightly more expensive 'suite' on her advice which had a couch etc & a bit more room for this longer stay. Upon checking in we were required to pay for the entire week in advance (!) In the bathroom, the handbasin was cracked all the way through, the towel rack above the toilet on a precarious lean, the vent had no cover so you could see right into the dirty & dusty piping in the ceiling (we were on the top floor) and the bed was on a definite 'lean' to one side. The TV remote did not work and you could only get 2 channels anyway. Every time the old-style lift operated there was a very loud 'clunk clunk' as it locked into the desired floor (apparently the machinery was beside/above our room) - so you can imagine how many times a day/night that happened. We asked if we could change rooms as soon as we noticed these things & was told "No, we are full, maybe if someone checks out " Refund was not an option either. As we had specifically requested a 'quieter' room when booking many months prior you can imagine our disappointment. After a totally sleepless night our room was changed the next afternoon another 'suite' lower down - this one too had bits missing in the bathroom & the maid had 'forgotten' to leave towels, soap & toilet paper, but did leave hairs on the sheets etc. We were told that the usual housekeeper was on holidays & they just 'couldn't get good staff' from the agencies! On the Saturday night there was a reception of some sort held in their function room. There was one floor between the microphone & our bed but no matter, we heard every drunken speech, every lyric to every song..I rang the Duty Manager after 11.30 pm to ask when would we expect some quiet & he said 2 AM ! I felt so sorry for the people under us - they must have been deafened (or maybe they were at the reception?) Anyhow, the next day the receptionist said that someone should have told us there were noisy functions like that so we could choose whether to stay or not. Nope, no-one had told us at check-in, the day before, or even that day so we could have made alternative arrangements. There was no apology from the Manager, he said "We're a pub, not a 5 star hotel, it's noisy, what do you expect?" and basically "If you don't like it you can always stay elsewhere". Well yes, maybe if you had given us our money back for the remainder of our stay we would have! I looked at rooms at the Park Regis virtually next door and they were so much better than the Hotel Coronation in all respects for only a few $$$ more I was so sorry we had not been able to move there. I have since booked our neighbours into the Park Regis TWICE since then & both times they have been really well looked after for the staff & loved it (and only paid $125 a night as they have a aged pension card - even less than the Coronation 'suite'). Yes, the location is really convenienct only 50 metres from Town Hall station. But do yourself a favour - stay at the Park Regis!

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED the Coronation”
Reviews.Author: CHKFlorida
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Coronation for a week in April prior to a cruise back to the US. Three other couples on the same cruise also stayed there--and we all were extremely happy with the hotel, the accommodations, food, bar, location, everything. For the price and location, the place is an absolute gem! The rooms are on the small side but were plenty big enough to accommodate the two of us and all of our gear (4 big suitcases, 2 carry-on bags and the 2 cases of wine we hauled on board the ship) The largest rooms face an interior "courtyard"--just an empty concrete space that holds the utilities (for AC and such). The rooms facing the street were about 1/4 to 1/3 smaller. All of the rooms were quiet and comfortable--and spotlessly clean. I swear they changed the sheets every day. Our bathroom had a small corner glass enclosure around the shower--apparently not all baths have the enclosures so you might want to ask. Each room has a refrigerator, a pot for heating water, plus glasses, cups, saucers and other essentials. There's an iron and ironing board in the closet. You can get a dryer by asking at the desk (if they seem to be out--ask them to check the housekeeping closet which is where one of the front desk clerks likes to stash them) The only minus I can think of with regard to the rooms is the limited number of TV channels--but we didn't go all the way to Australia to watch TV, so it wasn't a big deal. The food in the bar and restaurant was excellent, served in very generous portions, and very inexpensive. We esp. enjoyed getting together with the other "cruisers" in the bar for a beer after a hard day of sightseeing. My husband's lite beer cost only $2 AU (and the same beer was only $1 in the Coronation bottle shop right next door--compare this with $7 for the same beer at the Four Seasons!) And, of course, the location was fantastic--right next to Woolies and the Town Center railway station and just across from the Queen Victoria Building. We even found a 24 hr internet cafe about 2 blocks away that only charges $1.50 per hour (approx. 161 Elizabeth St) I guess some people might get put off by the lack of a proper lobby or the funky self-service elevator--but we thought it was perfect for our stay and would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: darren267
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the other comments on here, we stayed for a few nights and the room was an ok size, but was clean and tidy and that was more important. The aircon worked like a dream (remote controlled from the bed - nice). The bathroom was recently refurbished and was nice BUT the shower had no cubicle so the whole room gets soaked and our room often smelt of 'wet' hours after we'd showered, even with the window open. Overall a great hotel on a budget. Also it's soooo close to the train station which was very handy after we arrived with our backpacks after a flight from London.

Reviews.Title: “Great place at a low price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Coronation is in a great location (30 seconds walk from the Town Hall, Town Hall station, the QVB and Pitt St). We spent 5 nights here over New Years and thoroughly recommend it. We chose this hotel as it was in a great location and one of the few places that wasn't charging silly prices over New Years. It charged about $30AUD per night extra for 2 nights. Most places were doubling their prices. It's regular rates ($109AUD) are one of the best around in central Sydney for an ensuite room with aircon (which we needed on 1st Jan - 44 degrees!!). The room we had was fairly small, but this was because we had one of only 2 rooms with a balcony (rooms 402 and 403), which 'eat' into the room, but we were more than happy to compensate that for a balcony overlooking a bustling street. Despite being in a busy area we found the room very quiet (which was good to sleep off the jet lag) and the hotel in general was quiet - there are 21 rooms - and we only once or twice bumped into someone. The beds was really comfy and the ensuite was clean and decent sized. The Coronation also has: - a nice 24 hour bar - a bottle shop (handy for a few drinks in your room/balcony, as each room has a fridge). - a restaurant - cheapish prices for a place where you can get anything from oysters and champagne to beer and a burger. Most reviews are generally based on 'value for money' and mine's no different. It's not a world class hotel but for it's price I can't say a bad word against it. It's a great lowish budget 'classic' hotel but with all the trimmings (aircon, ensuite, tv, fridge, restaurant, bar) in a great area of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Decent and good price... considering the location”
Reviews.Author: Tombraider74
Reviews.Content: Good things: great location downtown with a supermarket, train station and 24 hour bar right next door(nighttime doorman at the bar very nice); in the heart of the city: George Street; only about a 15-20 minute walk to Darling Harbor and the Rocks; I paid only $109AU which aint too bad! Bad things: the lobby is essentially a hallway from the street; the front desk is only open during the day so if you have problems at night you have to contact the downstairs bar manager; no views; not a lot of ammenties; carpeting is kinda shabby; shower water temp fluctuates a little.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for location”
Reviews.Author: mmdownunder
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a number of times, some rooms are small but clean and for the price it is right in the middle of town eg town hall, it has a 24 hour bar and the Restaurant does put on a good feed!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Coronation
HotelInfo.Address: 5 -7 Park St, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
